column4: I've been banging my head against the wall this morning but I solved my problem
Virtualbox didn't uninstall cleanly and the Kernel Modules were slowing down the system
hehe
I do have a support question actually...
When I upgraded to Ubuntu 9.10 my Console text got Really Tiny
I would like to fix that
yes the text is almost unreadable
for me
Not X, the Console (CLI)
I'm not sure if that is still set by grub when using the new grub 2  but in grub 1 that was set on the grub boot line by specifying things like VGA=791 and so on
I tried that, when it gets so far, the font changes to a tiny font
tried changing that number to something else? there are lists of different VGA resolution mode numbers available
yes and no matter what the line is, the boot process goes so far then flash, something is loaded that says to run a tiny font.
hmmm.. not sure what that might be.. is this an fresh install of 9.10 or an updated 9.04?
Upgraded from 9.04 -> 9.10

I wonder if it's something you installed on 9.04.. I know there is a terminus console font package that you can install.. have you tried searching in synaptic for console font.. see if anything suspicius is installed?
I will do that right now
I think I figured it out, there is a file called /etc/default/console-setup where the fonts are chosen for the console
ah.. good hunting..
thank you so much
Thank you so much for your help, i found the utility to change console fonts - setupcon *hug*
